Comment.MultiLanguageText: Sends the open command to the output.
Alarm Configuration Mode Enable. (1 = Configuration Enabled)
Alarm Configuration Save. (1 = Save Data to PLC)

AttributeList.Text: This block contains all the logic required for the valve to be opened and closed.

This network handles the simulation of the valve control.
If SimulationMode and GlobalSimulation are FALSE, then the Open and Close requests from the HMI are passed to the OpenRequestHMI and CloseRequestHMI Bits.
IF SimulationMode or GlobalSimulation = TRUE, then the logic uses the SimulationStartRequest and SimulationStopRequest to enable and Disable the SimulatedStart and SimulatedStop bits.

Logic for opening and closing the valve from the HMI.
The Open & Close RequestHMI bits are sent through a Oneshot to prevent the OpenRequest and CloseRequest from being held on as TRUE.
If Interlocks = TRUE, and OpenCommanded OR OpenRequest = TRUE, and the CloseRequest = FALSE, the OpenCommanded bit = TRUE.
If OpenCommanded = TRUE, and CloseRequest = FALSE, the ValveCommand = TRUE. The ValveCommand is the actual bit that is sent to the Valve to control the state.
Open and Close Command from HMI
Position Fault - Monitoring for Alarm Condition
Fail to Close - Monitoring for Alarm Condition
Fail to Open - Monitoring For Alarm Condition
This network contains all the logic to write the existing alarm configuration values from the PLC memory to the HMI.
Configuration Mode - Write Existing Values to HMI
This network contains all the logic to read all the new alarm configuration values from the HMI to the PLC memory.
Configuration Mode - Read New Values from HMI
